intro: Seseli tortuosum subsp. tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately lobed and have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
